title: Issue Manager (FSM-based)
summary: Java bug management system using finite state machines for assignment, completion, and reporting.
outcome: 95% code coverage with 30+ unit/integration tests; 40% code complexity reduction using OOP patterns.
highlights: Modeled bug lifecycle via FSM for predictable transitions and reporting
CSV-based persistence for cross-session history tracking
Wrote 30+ tests and simplified polymorphism/enum usage to shrink complexity
lessons: Explicit state machines make business rules auditable
Tests are cheaper than retrofits—coverage held refactors steady

title: Reflectra – AI Wellness Copilot
summary: AI reflection chat that turns your browsing history into balanced wellness insights instead of just screen-time metrics.
outcome: Built a Chrome extension + Supabase + RAG stack that highlights focus patterns and mindful breaks directly from tab activity.
highlights: Ships an AI Reflection Chat powered by RAG over your personal browsing embeddings
Uses Pinecone to store per-site embeddings for context-rich recall of habits and focus trends
Dashboards tab activity to surface when you start passive scrolling vs. deep work stretches
Built and iterated the full stack in 36 hours with a team of three
lessons: Wellness insights beat raw screen-time; context matters more than minutes watched
Vector databases unlock personalized recall without storing raw histories
Shipping fast still needs observability—tracked extension events to keep the RAG answers reliable

title: Stock Sentiment Analyzer
summary: FastAPI service that merges finance/news sources and applies NLP sentiment for real-time portfolio insights.
outcome: Selected FinBERT for 92% test accuracy versus Vader; delivers live sentiment on user portfolios.
highlights: Aggregated Reddit, Yahoo Finance, and NewsAPI feeds before sentiment scoring
Benchmarked FinBERT vs Vader and productionized the higher-accuracy model
Built end-to-end ML pipeline with user portfolios and live updates
lessons: Model choice must be tied to data freshness—FinBERT wins on finance corpora
Input cleanliness (dedup, spam filtering) moves the accuracy needle most

title: Mood-Based Music Recommendation
summary: React + Node app that predicts mood from text and serves personalized songs via Spotify API.
outcome: ~90% mood detection accuracy and secure auth with bcrypt hashing and session management.
highlights: Full-stack app with React front-end and Node/Express backend
Integrated Spotify API to stream 5 personalized songs per query
Implemented REST API integration plus auth using bcrypt hashing
lessons: Latency budgets matter when chaining third-party APIs
Keep auth surfaces small—hash and salt everything, and scope tokens
